Html:
Hi All

I have been using this great dll for quite some time now and I think it is great.
I have a problem and I hope radioman or somebody can put me in right direction or even write some code for help.

I would appreciate if somebody can explain how I can implement OnMouse over event over route-points to simulate something like marker-tooltip.

I have tried the solution with markers but is is a bit slow if for example I have approx.10.000 markers per route, but drawing of just route with points added is quite fast so I would like to explore possibility to use existent route-points and just add point info/tooltip text for route-point (in global array) and use this info when mouse over point in route.
I hope somebody can help me out with this.

Best regards

Thank you radioman for your feedback but unfortunately I have all program already written on winfows forms.

I will try and take a look how is this solved in wpf maybe it will help me but if you have time can you please give me some directions how I can try and do this.

Looking forward for your feedback.

Best regards

:-) Thank you radioman.

Looking forward for your feedback. Have a nice day.

Best regards.

Hi radioman

Thanks for all new updates on gmap component. I didn't want to bother you since you have done great job regard arcgis but can you now just give me a little help regard OnMouse over event over route-points to simulate something like marker-tooltip.

Thanks.

Looking forward for oyur feedback.

Best regards.

Hi radioman

It is getting better and better :-))

I would appreciate if you can take a look at my question since I didn't find solution for my problem yet (I am using win.forms) :-(

I have also another question  - which solution you will develop and support in the future will this be win.forms or win.presentation.foundation or both in terms of funcionality and usability.

Looking forward for your feedback.

Best regards,

i'll try keep them both, but functionality can be a little different

p.s. i'll register this as issue on winforms
